info.title: ThirdPartyApi
info.description:
This API enables registered third paties to access others data when enabled by a power of attorney. There are three requirements to fullfill in order to get data: 1) You need to be registered as a third party. 2) You need to be authorized. 3) There must an active power of attorney that allows access to the metering points accessed. To be registered youll need to contact Energinet. Authorization is handled by using tokens. At first you will need a refresh token. You can generate a refresh token in the portal. Having a refresh token you can then access the /token endpoint and get a short lived access token. Using the access token all the below endpoints are accessable. A power of attorney grants access to one or more metering point in a specified period of time. This API only gives access to existing power of attorneys. Correlation id. It is possible to set a correlation id in the request header. Using the 'X-User-Correlation-ID' (with an UUID). When provided this id will follow the request and finally end in the response header. This id can be used for tracking the request. Parralel to this id there is another internally id (Also a UUID), wich also is returned in the response header as 'X-Correlation-ID'. Possible Error Codes:

General: NoError = 10000, WrongNumberOfArguments = 10001

MeteringPoint: WrongMeteringPointIdOrWebAccessCode = 20000, MeteringPointBlocked = 20001, MeteringPointAlreadyAdded = 20002, MeteringPointIdNot18CharsLong = 20003 MeteringPointAliasTooLong = 20005, WebAccessCodeNot8CharsLong = 20006, WebAccessCodeContainsIllegalChars = 20007, MeteringPointNotFound = 20008, MeteringPointIsChild = 20009, RelationNotFound = 20010, UnknownError = 20011, Unauthorized = 20012

MeterData: FromDateIsGreaterThanToday = 30000, FromDateIsGreaterThanToDate = 30001, ToDateCantBeEqualToFromDate = 30002, ToDateIsGreaterThanToday = 30003, InvalidDateFormat = 30004, InvalidRequestParameters = 30005, AccessToMeterPointDenied = 30006, NoMeterPointDataAviliable = 30007, RequestedAggregationUnavaliable = 30008, MaximumMeterPointsExceeded = 30009, InvalidMeterpointID = 30010, InternalServerError = 30011, DateNotCoveredByPowerOfAttorney = 30012

Authorization: InvalidCVR = 40000, InvalidIncludeFutureMeteringPointsRelatedToCVR = 40001, InvalidMasterDataFields = 40002, InvalidMeteringPointIds = 40003, InvalidSignature = 40004, InvalidSignedByNameId = 40005, InvalidSignedDate = 40006, InvalidSignedText = 40007, InvalidThirdPartyId = 40008, InvalidValidFrom = 40009, InvalidValidTo = 40010, ValidToBeforeValidFrom = 40011, ValidToOutOfRange = 40012, ValidFromOutOfRange = 40013, NoPowerOfAttorneysFound = 40014

Token: WrongTokenType = 50000, TokenNotValid = 50001, ErrorCreatingToken = 50002, TokenRegistrationFailed = 50003, TokenAlreadyActive = 50004, TokenAlreadyDeactivaed = 50005

ThirdParty: ThirdPartyNotFound = 60000

get.summary: Returns a list of metering points based on filter.
get.description: It is only possible to use one of the 3 parameters in a call. The other parameters must be null.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Define what kind of authorization id to filter on. Possible values are: 'authorizationId', 'customerCVR', 'customerKey'

schema.description: Define what kind of authorization id to filter on. Possible values are: 'authorizationId', 'customerCVR', 'customerKey'

401.description: When the provided token doesn't meet the requirements

get.description:
In order to get an access token you will need
a valid refresh token. This token can be fetched from the portal.
The token is a JWT token. There are tools that can read the content eg: https://jwt.io/
The token must be submittet in the request header like "Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOi..."

403.description: When a non-refresh token is used

401.description: When the provided token don't meet the requirements

In order to get an access token you will need

The token is a JWT token. There are tools that can read the content eg: https://jwt.io/
The token must be submittet in the request header like "Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOi..."

403.description: When a non-refresh token is used

401.description: When the provided token don't meet the requirements

meteringPointId.description: Meter point id of this child.

parentMeteringPointId.description: Meter point id of the parent.

meteringPointId.description: Identifier of the metering point, an 18 digits code.

accessFrom.description: Earliest date which third party has access to the metering point

accessTo.description: Last date which third party has access to the metering point

childMeteringPoints.description: List of child metering points to this meter.

id.description: Identifier UUID of this power of attorney

thirdPartyName.description: Name of the third party owning this power of attorney

validFrom.description: The earliest date allowed to request data on

validTo.description: Max date allowed to request data on

parentMeteringPointId.description: Id of a parent metering point.

typeOfMP.description: Type of metering point (consumption or production).

energyTimeSeriesMeasureUnit.description: Energy time series measure unit eg. KWH.

price.description: Price of the subscription in dkkr.
Price of the tariff in dkkr.

prices.description: Price of the tariff in dkkr. and hour of tariff

subscriptions.description: A list of subscriptions for the metering point.

tariffs.description: A list of tariffs for the metering point.

Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. Example: "Authorization: Bearer {token}"
Bearer.name: Authorization
